stories.title: Senator Warren Introduces Bill to Ban the Sale of Location and Health Data

stories.text: I have noticed that a lot of simple tasks are becoming more difficult to do with smartphones. For example in Android, it's basically impossible to set a countdown timer if the phone is locked without using a voice assistant. Apple might have implemented this specific feature better by allowing users to access the timer through the Control Center. However, iOS's calculator is just too cumbersome too use due its lack of features and lack of decent alternatives. What are your thoughts?
stories.title: Are our phones becoming too smart to do dumb stuff?

stories.text: We are a startup helping people to upskill or reskill to tech (software / IT). Is doing small freelancing projects through platforms such as Upwork / Fiverr a good way to gain hands-on experience before applying for full-time jobs?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is Upwork or Fiverr a good platform for gaining professional experience?
